snippet: Using language reminiscent of the Cold War, Chinese officials have voiced conspiracy theories accusing foreigners of plotting to weaken or overthrow the Communist Party.
abstract: Rising anti-Western sentiment, bordering on xenophobia, has emanated from highest levels of Chinese Communist Party and sent a chill through civil society and academia; Chinese officials, using language reminiscent of the Cold War, have voiced conspiracy theories accusing foreigners of plotting to weaken or overthrow the party.

byline.contributor: Dan Levin contributed reporting, and Mia Li contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Using language reminiscent of the Cold War, Chinese officials have voiced conspiracy theories accusing foreigners of plotting to weaken or overthrow the Communist Party.

headline.main: In New China, ‘Hostile’ West Is Still Derided
